body:
More marriages lasted, kids were raised by their mothers instead of the state, homes were cleaner and better administered, women and men were happier, quality of life was considerably better. 

Now the hens abandon the nest as soon as they can just to preen and chase shiny objects that make them feel like they have some type of control. 

If we were any other animal, scientists would be alarmed at our behavior.  We are devolving in real time.

If we were any other animal, scientists would be alarmed at our behavior. We are devolving in real time.

title: Life was better before women joined the workforce.

author.bio: I like Miyamoto Musashi and Doc Holliday.
author.bio_html: I like Miyamoto Musashi and Doc Holliday.

body:
Average male wages in terms of real numbers(economic definition of real numbers) stagnated in the late 70s. Women didn't enter the workforce out of some gender revolution so much as household economic necessity. You cannot afford 2021 real prices on a single 1979 real wage.

This also doubles the taxable individuals. So the government doesn't care.

Nowadays own a lot of stuff and with everybody wanted to be rich and succesfull that is apparently a need from society now. And that need can be satissfied because the boost in production from women joining the workforce. 

I also think its important for a individual to earn their own money cause it learns a lot of responsibility and independence. Its creates strong people that know how to take care from themselfs

body:
I don’t know that women entering the workforce was the catalyst. I think it was earlier than that. When this country was founded only land and business owners were allowed to vote. The people with the voting power are always going to vote for what is in their best interests. 

So business and land owners are going to vote to keep policies that help all businesses and land owners, which has the side effect of keeping the country prosperous. Dipshits and losers are going to vote for unsustainable things that are worse for everyone including themselves long term but might benefit themselves short term. 

The way we got to where we are now is the people at the top figured this out in the late 1800’s and changed the voting rules for “muh equality”. Then they set out to ensure the number of dipshits and losers was much greater than the number of people who would vote for society’s best long term interests. So women in the workplace is just a symptom not the cause.

body:
If work actually paid a really decent amount and would afford more like it did in the 50's to the 70's I think it would work out OK for women to get out of the workforce. But they are here to stay now, things cost an inordinate amount more than they did. You have to be so smart with your money now.

Keep in mind though, the quality of life for most people has risen greatly since they have joined the workforce, of course I don't envy anyone too much in raising a family but I wish them the best of luck and hope it works out for them. It must be very stressful to take care of kids during a pandemic and both parents are working or trying to find work.

body:
Women always worked

The entire concept of "going to work" was uncommon before the industrial revolution. Sure sailors, merchants, or mercenaries would travel far from home in search of pay, but most people performed agricultural labor within walking distance of their house. There was often practical segregation of labor based on ability but when harvest time came typically your wife and your kids were working in the fields and right beside you. Specialists like smiths or tailors would have their shops adjacent to or on the bottom floor of their house.

At the beginning of the industrial revolution factories were full of women. 

I think the real issue is how modern life takes people away from their family and neighbors and surrounds them with strangers for so much of our waking hours.

body: The problem to the system was that men weren't spending enough.  They were investing for better future, cut back on unnecessary luxuries, rejected most of their women's spending proposals because 99% of them were usually garbage and useless.  This hurt a lot of rich investors.  The elites who profited off all those wars were looking for ways to increase the average spending by the masses so they could control the market and thus the cash flow.  They saw the individualistic men acting as barriers preventing their women and children entering into the mindless consumerism "utopia" the rich had laid down.  So they schemed and funded the feminism movement for decades.  Basically vilified every living male in the eyes of a woman.  Those retards took the bait.  Not just any ordinary 'taking' of the bait, they took the bait so hard like their entire life and their gender were depending on it.  They left the wholesome conservative family lifestyle to voluntarily becoming a wage slave to some corporation in the act of "liberation" of female gender.  That is the ultimate irony of all this.  The elites got what they wanted.  Average spending increased, the amount of taxation increased, the amount of debt increased.  People who spoke against it were character assassinated.  Back in the silent generation, a single man could provide for the whole family (includes half a dozen kids).  Now even if both parents work, there is no guarantee that kid is going to be useful to this society.  At best, it will be another wage slave.

body:
There are different "waves" of feminism, that can be broadly classified as "being about gender equality" (the earlier ones) and "not being about gender equality" (the latest ones). I do believe that the former waves made women better off, but the latter waves were the shot in the foot. Even though the "projectile" is mostly still in flight.

Also, what OP describes is more the product of culture than the gender. I have worked with lots of women who are terrific colleagues, being 100% feminine women at the same time and not trying to behave like men. It is so, I believe, because the social justice poison has not yet taken over my country.

parent.body:
I don’t know that women entering the workforce was the catalyst. I think it was earlier than that. When this country was founded only land and business owners were allowed to vote. The people with the voting power are always going to vote for what is in their best interests. 

So business and land owners are going to vote to keep policies that help all businesses and land owners, which has the side effect of keeping the country prosperous. Dipshits and losers are going to vote for unsustainable things that are worse for everyone including themselves long term but might benefit themselves short term. 

The way we got to where we are now is the people at the top figured this out in the late 1800’s and changed the voting rules for “muh equality”. Then they set out to ensure the number of dipshits and losers was much greater than the number of people who would vote for society’s best long term interests. So women in the workplace is just a symptom not the cause.

parent.body:
If work actually paid a really decent amount and would afford more like it did in the 50's to the 70's I think it would work out OK for women to get out of the workforce. But they are here to stay now, things cost an inordinate amount more than they did. You have to be so smart with your money now.

Keep in mind though, the quality of life for most people has risen greatly since they have joined the workforce, of course I don't envy anyone too much in raising a family but I wish them the best of luck and hope it works out for them. It must be very stressful to take care of kids during a pandemic and both parents are working or trying to find work.

body:
Oh please, times have changed but wages haven't kept up with them. The mindset in people has changed too. If I can't come up with my half of bills or if I need to ask for money, my husband would be pissed. He also keeps track of anything I fall short on and demands to be paid back. 

But then when he falls short on something, he demands the money from me and paying me back isn't really a thing. 

He also literally make 2x what I do. (Though I'm going back to school currently to up my employment opportunities bc minimum wage just doesn't cut it)

It worked back then when wages matched the economy. Somewhere along the way, wages took a hit but the economy kept booming.

body:
Overall, so long as you're not living in poverty as you've described it, I would say the quality of life of most people has risen greatly since they have joined the workforce.

There's an internet full of knowledge, films, tv shows, games, music, audiobooks and more. I can buy cryptocurrency now, in addition I can use a phone to pay for things as well as money. There is unemployment benefits and a council that will help me if I have fucked up my life completely somehow. There is better treatment for health conditions. There is an exciting future for space exploration with SpaceX. There are flying drones and robots that deliver shit to your door. There are new foods available now, some that I will probably hate and avoid (bugs, soy, soylent). There are vertical farms to grow stuff in cargo containers. I'm probably missing a lot of other great things.

I mean you're probably still right, there is a point to be made that poverty has gotten worse lately and I think it's down to the pandemic.

They were investing for better future, cut back on unnecessary luxuries, rejected most of their women's spending proposals because 99% of them were usually garbage and useless.  This hurt a lot of rich investors.  The elites who profited off all those wars were looking for ways to increase the average spending by the masses so they could control the market and thus the cash flow.  They saw the individualistic men acting as barriers preventing their women and children entering into the mindless consumerism "utopia" the rich had laid down.  So they schemed and funded the feminism movement for decades.  Basically vilified every living male in the eyes of a woman.  Those retards took the bait.  Not just any ordinary 'taking' of the bait, they took the bait so hard like their entire life and their gender were depending on it.  They left the wholesome conservative family lifestyle to voluntarily becoming a wage slave to some corporation in the act of "liberation" of female gender.  That is the ultimate irony of all this.  The elites got what they wanted.  Average spending increased, the amount of taxation increased, the amount of debt increased.  People who spoke against it were character assassinated.  Back in the silent generation, a single man could provide for the whole family (includes half a dozen kids).  Now even if both parents work, there is no guarantee that kid is going to be useful to this society.  At best, it will be another wage slave.

parent.body:
Women always worked

The entire concept of "going to work" was uncommon before the industrial revolution. Sure sailors, merchants, or mercenaries would travel far from home in search of pay, but most people performed agricultural labor within walking distance of their house. There was often practical segregation of labor based on ability but when harvest time came typically your wife and your kids were working in the fields and right beside you. Specialists like smiths or tailors would have their shops adjacent to or on the bottom floor of their house.

At the beginning of the industrial revolution factories were full of women. 

I think the real issue is how modern life takes people away from their family and neighbors and surrounds them with strangers for so much of our waking hours.

parent.body:
There are different "waves" of feminism, that can be broadly classified as "being about gender equality" (the earlier ones) and "not being about gender equality" (the latest ones). I do believe that the former waves made women better off, but the latter waves were the shot in the foot. Even though the "projectile" is mostly still in flight.

Also, what OP describes is more the product of culture than the gender. I have worked with lots of women who are terrific colleagues, being 100% feminine women at the same time and not trying to behave like men. It is so, I believe, because the social justice poison has not yet taken over my country.

body: It strikes me as very odd that you are talking about Economics solely from the optic of purchasing power. You can't just take macroeconomics out of the equation. Even if you somehow increased the value of labour (for example, by eliminating half the supply), you'd be creating more problems, even for the individual worker, due to the effects that reducing the available labour would have in the country's productive capacity.

parent.body:
If work actually paid a really decent amount and would afford more like it did in the 50's to the 70's I think it would work out OK for women to get out of the workforce. But they are here to stay now, things cost an inordinate amount more than they did. You have to be so smart with your money now.

Keep in mind though, the quality of life for most people has risen greatly since they have joined the workforce, of course I don't envy anyone too much in raising a family but I wish them the best of luck and hope it works out for them. It must be very stressful to take care of kids during a pandemic and both parents are working or trying to find work.

body:
You can live a 1972 lifestyle real cheap if you want it. Landline phone and tv with rabbit ears. Cars with no power steering or safety features. There are three restaurants in town, and Italian is still 'ethnic' food. No smartphone, internet, or cable. No video games, sports channels, or HBO. If you get cancer, you can avail yourself of medical technology is not that much better than it was in 1930. If you get diabetes you can stick yourself with a giant ass needle full of crappy immediate release insulin half a dozen times per day. 

Personally I'll take the present, thanks.

parent.body:
If work actually paid a really decent amount and would afford more like it did in the 50's to the 70's I think it would work out OK for women to get out of the workforce. But they are here to stay now, things cost an inordinate amount more than they did. You have to be so smart with your money now.

Keep in mind though, the quality of life for most people has risen greatly since they have joined the workforce, of course I don't envy anyone too much in raising a family but I wish them the best of luck and hope it works out for them. It must be very stressful to take care of kids during a pandemic and both parents are working or trying to find work.

body:
You've listed a bunch of bread and circus...

We're dumber,  fatter, and more mentally ill than ever.   We have less free time than even medieval serfs had.  Divorce and single parent households at record highs.   Suicides are epidemic.  Debt is crippling.   Personal savings at record lows. 

This was all true even before covid hysteria.

parent.body:
Overall, so long as you're not living in poverty as you've described it, I would say the quality of life of most people has risen greatly since they have joined the workforce.

There's an internet full of knowledge, films, tv shows, games, music, audiobooks and more. I can buy cryptocurrency now, in addition I can use a phone to pay for things as well as money. There is unemployment benefits and a council that will help me if I have fucked up my life completely somehow. There is better treatment for health conditions. There is an exciting future for space exploration with SpaceX. There are flying drones and robots that deliver shit to your door. There are new foods available now, some that I will probably hate and avoid (bugs, soy, soylent). There are vertical farms to grow stuff in cargo containers. I'm probably missing a lot of other great things.

I mean you're probably still right, there is a point to be made that poverty has gotten worse lately and I think it's down to the pandemic.

parent.body:
Oh please, times have changed but wages haven't kept up with them. The mindset in people has changed too. If I can't come up with my half of bills or if I need to ask for money, my husband would be pissed. He also keeps track of anything I fall short on and demands to be paid back. 

But then when he falls short on something, he demands the money from me and paying me back isn't really a thing. 

He also literally make 2x what I do. (Though I'm going back to school currently to up my employment opportunities bc minimum wage just doesn't cut it)

It worked back then when wages matched the economy. Somewhere along the way, wages took a hit but the economy kept booming.

body:
I was speculating that if the purchasing power of todays wages was higher now, more women could choose to get out of the workforce, but because that's not the case, women are here to stay in work and largely most of the things we buy today will cost more in the future so we all don't have much of a choice in the matter.

I don't think it's too great that all people are working in an economy, there is housework to be done, children to parent, places to visit, things to do and more to life than just work. It's probably great for the economy at the moment in terms of productive capacity but not so great if you're trying to find work because there are so much more people in the pool of work that have to compete for jobs.

parent.body: It strikes me as very odd that you are talking about Economics solely from the optic of purchasing power. You can't just take macroeconomics out of the equation. Even if you somehow increased the value of labour (for example, by eliminating half the supply), you'd be creating more problems, even for the individual worker, due to the effects that reducing the available labour would have in the country's productive capacity.

body:
Yeah and I’m fine with that when it happens. Marriage is a loyal commitment that sometimes requires the other person to sacrifice, and lives that move toward the same goals. 

However until marriage, I’m happy to be independent with personal boundaries and the ability to be self reliant and as a whole person effectively and emotionally. I also wouldn’t be a very good partner either if I couldn’t do some things on my own. I also think that everyone should have the ability to provide for themselves. Who knows if you become a widow. 

But I also think for some people it’s okay if they don’t want to get married. The Bible says some are called to independent celibacy in serving the Lord in their calling. 

I do want to get married though and I also want participate in the world.

body:
> Yes, the water is wet

No, water is not wet. Something is wet if water is on its surface. Water cannot be on water's surface, because it just merges with the water, becoming part of the surface.

>  that holds little to no bearing to the post

Well, good thing I wasn't responding to the post then, isn't it? I was responding to the comment to the post.

> there are also commonalities that are noticeable and true

If you're saying "I see a statistical trend", then I'm inclined to agree. However, he either doesn't notice or doesn't care, and therefore I pointed it out, because his generalisation is inaccurate. On the other hand, if you're saying "these are inalienable traits common to all women", then I have to state that your assertion is retarded.

body:
> more women could choose to get out of the workforce

They _could,_ but do you think they _would?_ I don't.

> the things we buy today will cost more in the future

How come? Usually, technological advancement tends to **decrease**, not increase, production costs (ergo prices).

> there is housework to be done

Use the extra money from the woman also working to hire a maid

> children to parent

You can have both parents working and still parent a child. I know from experience - both my parents worked.

> places to visit, things to do and more to life than just work

LOL! So your solution is taking women out of the workforce so that they can visit places and have fun while the men are working day and night to pay the bills? _Yes, this seems fair to me..._

> not so great if you're trying to find work 

True but irrelevant. You're once again thinking from the point of view of the individual rather than macroeconomics.

parent.body:
I was speculating that if the purchasing power of todays wages was higher now, more women could choose to get out of the workforce, but because that's not the case, women are here to stay in work and largely most of the things we buy today will cost more in the future so we all don't have much of a choice in the matter.

I don't think it's too great that all people are working in an economy, there is housework to be done, children to parent, places to visit, things to do and more to life than just work. It's probably great for the economy at the moment in terms of productive capacity but not so great if you're trying to find work because there are so much more people in the pool of work that have to compete for jobs.

body:
There have only been 4 or 5 presidential elections in our history that were rigged. 2020 the obvious one, but 1876, 1960, and potentially a couple others. Most of the time there is no need to rig because they have controlled puppet vs controlled puppet. In 2016 they completely believed Hillary would win, and they probably didn't have the infrastructure in place to rig it since the electoral college victory was not particularly narrow and it had been decades since a rigging. 

Evidence for this is the audit in 2016 conducted in MI requested by Jill Stein on behalf of Hillary. It ended up being called off by Hillary part way through because they were finding more Trump votes and his lead was getting bigger. If they had known that's what they'd find, do you think they would have called for the audit in the first place? Also, yes, 2016 had more large scale audits done than the zero that were conducted in 2020. We live in clown world.

The situation is garbage and clown world but there is always a margin of fraud. Yes, 40 something percent of people are retarded enough to actually vote for Biden. I have plenty in my family. Without fraud Trump probably only wins those close states by 1 or 2 percent. If it was an overwhelming victory it would have overcame the fraud. Is it fucked up that this is what we need to overcome? Yes. But getting black pilled and thinking its impossible is the only thing that guarantees that they win every time.

body:
hopefully the transgender "men" in sports can draw attention to biological differences again

Things like the Civil Rights Act have artificially restrained natural competition which could result in more traditional arrangements, or which made certain conservative arrangements illegal (possibly)

The problem works itself out a little bit, as modern societies are having fertility problems but those groups that follow traditional gender norms (like the Amish) are on pace to eventually populate the world given enough time and the same trends

If people learn to either produce more or be content with less, more traditional gender "lifestyles" are possible. Out of a mix of perhaps need and greed, women entered the workforce and then society became accustomed to higher (unnecessary) standards. I see some women post now and again, "wait, why did women want to go to college and enter the workforce when a man can just do that for them, again?" So, some women notice the newly created problems.

Conditions need to be created or strengthened to support these kinds of norms, like making it a "reponsible" choice for women to opt not to go to college, and for high school curriculums preparing women for a different life (see also ["women's work"](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Women's_work)). Men are put in a position of needing to perhaps be even more aggressive and competitive in response to the pressures applied by attempting to reduce their productive ability as well as diluting the value of average effort by raising the incomes of women.

There's also the "drop out" of "normal" society approach which works a bit. We're here on Ruqqus, rather than making a fuss on R*ddit, we just come here, and similarly there are men and women who want to live traditional lives that just find each other and make the best of things under the circumstances.

parent.body:
Women always worked

The entire concept of "going to work" was uncommon before the industrial revolution. Sure sailors, merchants, or mercenaries would travel far from home in search of pay, but most people performed agricultural labor within walking distance of their house. There was often practical segregation of labor based on ability but when harvest time came typically your wife and your kids were working in the fields and right beside you. Specialists like smiths or tailors would have their shops adjacent to or on the bottom floor of their house.

At the beginning of the industrial revolution factories were full of women. 

I think the real issue is how modern life takes people away from their family and neighbors and surrounds them with strangers for so much of our waking hours.

body: Yup, though it varied regionally. Women in the northwest of England worked in mills since mills existed, for example. In the midlands it tended to be light engineering. In the southeast it was less common for women to be working in factories. Engles whines about women working and men staying at home to raise the kids in his book, claiming it's unnatural - lefties don't know that because they've never read the stuff they're inspired by.

parent.body:
There have only been 4 or 5 presidential elections in our history that were rigged. 2020 the obvious one, but 1876, 1960, and potentially a couple others. Most of the time there is no need to rig because they have controlled puppet vs controlled puppet. In 2016 they completely believed Hillary would win, and they probably didn't have the infrastructure in place to rig it since the electoral college victory was not particularly narrow and it had been decades since a rigging. 

Evidence for this is the audit in 2016 conducted in MI requested by Jill Stein on behalf of Hillary. It ended up being called off by Hillary part way through because they were finding more Trump votes and his lead was getting bigger. If they had known that's what they'd find, do you think they would have called for the audit in the first place? Also, yes, 2016 had more large scale audits done than the zero that were conducted in 2020. We live in clown world.

The situation is garbage and clown world but there is always a margin of fraud. Yes, 40 something percent of people are retarded enough to actually vote for Biden. I have plenty in my family. Without fraud Trump probably only wins those close states by 1 or 2 percent. If it was an overwhelming victory it would have overcame the fraud. Is it fucked up that this is what we need to overcome? Yes. But getting black pilled and thinking its impossible is the only thing that guarantees that they win every time.

body:
So if they *want* to be in the workforce then why is that a problem?

> LOL! So your solution is taking women out of the workforce so that they can visit places and have fun while the men are working day and night to pay the bills? Yes, this seems fair to me...

It isn't fair but that's how life works. Women are the nurturers, they're more creative, they're smarter, they're more empathetic, they're better at interacting, they're better at focusing and organizing and not slacking off or procrastinating, they're better at multitasking and learning, and they're more joyful and content. Males are expendable, easily replaced, have no value apart from what they provide, and are biologically hardwired to be dumb, angry, irritable, and miserable because it makes them better warriors. Men even feel pain worse than women despite having to face more brutal situations (other than pregnancy and periods ofc) because their bodies don't give a shit about them; they're just the slaves working for women and children. Both sexes are essential and men are absolutely needed, but it's definitely not fair. Women unconditionally have enormous value but a man's only worth is in what he does, and that's how it's always worked.

So if they want to be in the workforce then why is that a problem?

LOL! So your solution is taking women out of the workforce so that they can visit places and have fun while the men are working day and night to pay the bills? Yes, this seems fair to me...

It isn't fair but that's how life works. Women are the nurturers, they're more creative, they're smarter, they're more empathetic, they're better at interacting, they're better at focusing and organizing and not slacking off or procrastinating, they're better at multitasking and learning, and they're more joyful and content. Males are expendable, easily replaced, have no value apart from what they provide, and are biologically hardwired to be dumb, angry, irritable, and miserable because it makes them better warriors. Men even feel pain worse than women despite having to face more brutal situations (other than pregnancy and periods ofc) because their bodies don't give a shit about them; they're just the slaves working for women and children. Both sexes are essential and men are absolutely needed, but it's definitely not fair. Women unconditionally have enormous value but a man's only worth is in what he does, and that's how it's always worked.

parent.body:
> more women could choose to get out of the workforce

They _could,_ but do you think they _would?_ I don't.

> the things we buy today will cost more in the future

How come? Usually, technological advancement tends to **decrease**, not increase, production costs (ergo prices).

> there is housework to be done

Use the extra money from the woman also working to hire a maid

> children to parent

You can have both parents working and still parent a child. I know from experience - both my parents worked.

> places to visit, things to do and more to life than just work

LOL! So your solution is taking women out of the workforce so that they can visit places and have fun while the men are working day and night to pay the bills? _Yes, this seems fair to me..._

> not so great if you're trying to find work 

True but irrelevant. You're once again thinking from the point of view of the individual rather than macroeconomics.

body: The traditional way is more unfair to men. We have to do all the work, and take all the responsibility, and someone else gets all the rewards. We can't have our own problems or emotions, because we only matter as far as we provide something. We're expendable and easily replaced. We're slaves basically, while the women are valued unconditionally. Men only have one option, which is to go to school, get a job, and die. Women can do that plus a whole bunch of other stuff, and they're allowed to be lazy, open up about their problems, and are held to lower standards by society. Sounds like male privilege to me!

parent.body:
hopefully the transgender "men" in sports can draw attention to biological differences again

Things like the Civil Rights Act have artificially restrained natural competition which could result in more traditional arrangements, or which made certain conservative arrangements illegal (possibly)

The problem works itself out a little bit, as modern societies are having fertility problems but those groups that follow traditional gender norms (like the Amish) are on pace to eventually populate the world given enough time and the same trends

If people learn to either produce more or be content with less, more traditional gender "lifestyles" are possible. Out of a mix of perhaps need and greed, women entered the workforce and then society became accustomed to higher (unnecessary) standards. I see some women post now and again, "wait, why did women want to go to college and enter the workforce when a man can just do that for them, again?" So, some women notice the newly created problems.

Conditions need to be created or strengthened to support these kinds of norms, like making it a "reponsible" choice for women to opt not to go to college, and for high school curriculums preparing women for a different life (see also ["women's work"](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Women's_work)). Men are put in a position of needing to perhaps be even more aggressive and competitive in response to the pressures applied by attempting to reduce their productive ability as well as diluting the value of average effort by raising the incomes of women.

There's also the "drop out" of "normal" society approach which works a bit. We're here on Ruqqus, rather than making a fuss on R*ddit, we just come here, and similarly there are men and women who want to live traditional lives that just find each other and make the best of things under the circumstances.

There's also the "drop out" of "normal" society approach which works a bit. We're here on Ruqqus, rather than making a fuss on R*ddit, we just come here, and similarly there are men and women who want to live traditional lives that just find each other and make the best of things under the circumstances.

body: It would be more efficient in the modern world if the duties were equally split. Traditionally almost all the responsibility was pinned on the husband, while the wife just stayed home and did whatever. Biologically we're still designed for this unfair system but it's not going to change by reinforcing it.

body:
Most men are simpleminded: https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/how-mens-brains-are-wired-differently-than-women/

> The research, which involved imaging the brains of nearly 1,000 adolescents, found that male brains had more connections within hemispheres, whereas female brains were more connected between hemispheres. The results, which apply to the population as a whole and not individuals, suggest that male brains may be optimized for motor skills, and female brains may be optimized for combining analytical and intuitive thinking.

>  As a whole, the young men had stronger connections within cerebral hemispheres while the young women had stronger connections between hemispheres, the study, detailed today (Dec. 2) in the journal Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, found. However, the cerebellum, a part of the brain below the cerebrum that plays a role in coordinating muscle movement, showed the opposite pattern, with males having stronger connections between hemispheres.
> 
> Roughly speaking, the back of the brain handles perception and the front of the brain handles action; the left hemisphere of the brain is the seat of logical thinking, while the right side of the brain begets intuitive thinking. The findings lend support to the view that males may excel at motor skills, while women may be better at integrating analysis and intuitive thinking.

So half the world is not going to like that adjustment. And even if you're not simple-minded, you still enjoy fun stuff more than boring stuff. If not, then get off the internet.
body_html:
Most men are simpleminded: https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/how-mens-brains-are-wired-differently-than-women/

The research, which involved imaging the brains of nearly 1,000 adolescents, found that male brains had more connections within hemispheres, whereas female brains were more connected between hemispheres. The results, which apply to the population as a whole and not individuals, suggest that male brains may be optimized for motor skills, and female brains may be optimized for combining analytical and intuitive thinking.

As a whole, the young men had stronger connections within cerebral hemispheres while the young women had stronger connections between hemispheres, the study, detailed today (Dec. 2) in the journal Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, found. However, the cerebellum, a part of the brain below the cerebrum that plays a role in coordinating muscle movement, showed the opposite pattern, with males having stronger connections between hemispheres.

Roughly speaking, the back of the brain handles perception and the front of the brain handles action; the left hemisphere of the brain is the seat of logical thinking, while the right side of the brain begets intuitive thinking. The findings lend support to the view that males may excel at motor skills, while women may be better at integrating analysis and intuitive thinking.

So half the world is not going to like that adjustment. And even if you're not simple-minded, you still enjoy fun stuff more than boring stuff. If not, then get off the internet.

parent.body:
Most men are simpleminded: https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/how-mens-brains-are-wired-differently-than-women/

> The research, which involved imaging the brains of nearly 1,000 adolescents, found that male brains had more connections within hemispheres, whereas female brains were more connected between hemispheres. The results, which apply to the population as a whole and not individuals, suggest that male brains may be optimized for motor skills, and female brains may be optimized for combining analytical and intuitive thinking.

>  As a whole, the young men had stronger connections within cerebral hemispheres while the young women had stronger connections between hemispheres, the study, detailed today (Dec. 2) in the journal Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, found. However, the cerebellum, a part of the brain below the cerebrum that plays a role in coordinating muscle movement, showed the opposite pattern, with males having stronger connections between hemispheres.
> 
> Roughly speaking, the back of the brain handles perception and the front of the brain handles action; the left hemisphere of the brain is the seat of logical thinking, while the right side of the brain begets intuitive thinking. The findings lend support to the view that males may excel at motor skills, while women may be better at integrating analysis and intuitive thinking.

So half the world is not going to like that adjustment. And even if you're not simple-minded, you still enjoy fun stuff more than boring stuff. If not, then get off the internet.
parent.body_html:
Most men are simpleminded: https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/how-mens-brains-are-wired-differently-than-women/

The research, which involved imaging the brains of nearly 1,000 adolescents, found that male brains had more connections within hemispheres, whereas female brains were more connected between hemispheres. The results, which apply to the population as a whole and not individuals, suggest that male brains may be optimized for motor skills, and female brains may be optimized for combining analytical and intuitive thinking.

As a whole, the young men had stronger connections within cerebral hemispheres while the young women had stronger connections between hemispheres, the study, detailed today (Dec. 2) in the journal Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, found. However, the cerebellum, a part of the brain below the cerebrum that plays a role in coordinating muscle movement, showed the opposite pattern, with males having stronger connections between hemispheres.

Roughly speaking, the back of the brain handles perception and the front of the brain handles action; the left hemisphere of the brain is the seat of logical thinking, while the right side of the brain begets intuitive thinking. The findings lend support to the view that males may excel at motor skills, while women may be better at integrating analysis and intuitive thinking.

So half the world is not going to like that adjustment. And even if you're not simple-minded, you still enjoy fun stuff more than boring stuff. If not, then get off the internet.

body:
We have evolved way past primal animalistic instincts and behaviours and for good reason. Just as an example, high ranking chefs, clothing designers, cleaning product designers tend to be men, but their work is stereotyped as female. There is no strict boundary between males and females other than body structure and genitals.

The decline of society and happiness is due to neoliberalism and corporate slavery, stagnation of lower class wages. It has nothing to do with gender or gender roles.

body:
You're basically arguing a retarded version of broken windows fallacy; sorry if I'm not really sure where to go with it.   A job isn't good or necessary or productive for society simply because it exists.   I'm guessing you are a liberal Democrat who believes in the need for government to create jobs?

>haven't explained how the inceeased wage employment has generated no increase in productivity

and I don't need to because that isn't my retarded premise,  it's yours.  My premise is that whatever productivity those extra jobs create is unimportant compared to the negative impact on society left by women abandoning their duties.   Productivity is subjective.  Just because they can create transactions doesn't mean those transactions are good.

parent.body:
So if they *want* to be in the workforce then why is that a problem?

> LOL! So your solution is taking women out of the workforce so that they can visit places and have fun while the men are working day and night to pay the bills? Yes, this seems fair to me...

It isn't fair but that's how life works. Women are the nurturers, they're more creative, they're smarter, they're more empathetic, they're better at interacting, they're better at focusing and organizing and not slacking off or procrastinating, they're better at multitasking and learning, and they're more joyful and content. Males are expendable, easily replaced, have no value apart from what they provide, and are biologically hardwired to be dumb, angry, irritable, and miserable because it makes them better warriors. Men even feel pain worse than women despite having to face more brutal situations (other than pregnancy and periods ofc) because their bodies don't give a shit about them; they're just the slaves working for women and children. Both sexes are essential and men are absolutely needed, but it's definitely not fair. Women unconditionally have enormous value but a man's only worth is in what he does, and that's how it's always worked.

So if they want to be in the workforce then why is that a problem?

LOL! So your solution is taking women out of the workforce so that they can visit places and have fun while the men are working day and night to pay the bills? Yes, this seems fair to me...

It isn't fair but that's how life works. Women are the nurturers, they're more creative, they're smarter, they're more empathetic, they're better at interacting, they're better at focusing and organizing and not slacking off or procrastinating, they're better at multitasking and learning, and they're more joyful and content. Males are expendable, easily replaced, have no value apart from what they provide, and are biologically hardwired to be dumb, angry, irritable, and miserable because it makes them better warriors. Men even feel pain worse than women despite having to face more brutal situations (other than pregnancy and periods ofc) because their bodies don't give a shit about them; they're just the slaves working for women and children. Both sexes are essential and men are absolutely needed, but it's definitely not fair. Women unconditionally have enormous value but a man's only worth is in what he does, and that's how it's always worked.

I'm not obliged to debate every rambling wino in every alley, sometimes laughing and walking away is the prudent thing to do.  

We have vastly different hormones, vastly different cognitive and reasoning processes, vastly different development,  vastly different abilities, vastly different biological imperatives... the science is overwhelming.   Of course there are outliers,  but his comment was simply dumb.

body:
I'm curious, where did you hear people talk like this? I have only heard it in MGTOW circles and it seems like historical revisionism. I like MGTOW but only as a life that is brought on by modern conditions making marriage impossible, not out of a rejection of marriage that considers it inherently a bad thing (merely "the plantation" rather than the fundamentally necessary bond that builds families and therefore society). 

I think this MGTOW view camd about because some relationships are nightmares today, so then some people concluded, "and you know what, it was never that good to begin with!" That's a bit of a jump there though in thinking.

There is the belief that the traditional way is the only way - there's no real alternative option, so whether it is unfair or not is kind of beside the point. Sure, in some ways it is unfair, and in many ways today life is unfair to both men and women.

The MGTOW view also seems to be inherently atheistic. Men are rewarded for their work in this life or the next. If women do not work as much in this life, then there is less reward for them in the afterlife. But there is plenty of work for traditional women, it's just "women's work" rather than men's work. Sure, life may be a "rip off" for some men if they dont believe in an afterlife and arent rewarded for some efforts made in this life.

You were traditionally allowed to have emotions and problems. Maybe not in all environments but that is the same as today, you just needed and need to find people to confide in.

Men only had the option to go to school and get a job. Well again what is the alternative? Today marriages where the woman makes more, like if a husband wanted to stay at home, these are more likely to cause dissatisfaction and divorce statistically. 

I guess I would need to hear what your view is on how things should be in order to critique it. We agree in rejecting the feminist view, I think. I like the traditional view but you seem to be skeptical of this out of a MGTOW view. But what kind of sustainable alternative do MGTOWs propose? Single parents who have children grown in labs? How is that more natural or better?

parent.body: The traditional way is more unfair to men. We have to do all the work, and take all the responsibility, and someone else gets all the rewards. We can't have our own problems or emotions, because we only matter as far as we provide something. We're expendable and easily replaced. We're slaves basically, while the women are valued unconditionally. Men only have one option, which is to go to school, get a job, and die. Women can do that plus a whole bunch of other stuff, and they're allowed to be lazy, open up about their problems, and are held to lower standards by society. Sounds like male privilege to me!

body:
I'm not a MGTOW. I just know that that being a male, I'm easily replaced and my only value is in what I provide. That's how nature works, and biologically males are designed to have miserable lives because that's how they best serve their function as warriors and laborers, doing all the dirty work no one wants to do. This isn't just in marriage, overall male positive emotions are numbed and anger is sharpened. We're not as smart, even in "male" fields like STEM and programming, and anything non-STEM our ability is basically zero. We're less creative, can have less fun, can even dream less. Basically we're either bored or angry, all the time. We even dream less. Males even feel pain more despite having to go through brutal situations more often, because we don't matter biologically. On the flip side women are designed to be smart, creative, good at interacting, and overall joyful. Even sex, men have an uncontrollable drive for it, and only have one orgasm which releases discomfort. Women have multiple orgasms which are simple bliss, although they also have periods, pregnancy, and childbirth, so I guess that's fair.

This is reflected in society too. Men are expected to take on everyone elses' responsibilities, without complaint, and not show any "weakness" or ask for help with our problems. All our anger, depression, etc. we will be punished for letting out (they commit suicide 3.5x more). Men are always the last priority in life, women and children first. Men don't matter, we're slaves.

Unfortunately the male skills are more or less obsolete nowadays.

Actually until recently it was the opposite, paganism has always emphasized the traditional gender roles, to the point where women are not allowed to do anything but have children. Nearly every ancient civilization and empire was based on this system. It was actually the abrahamic religions that originally promoted equality. The reason it changed was because the roman empire was threatened by the rapid rise of christianity, so they established a church system which inserted all kinds of greco-roman traditions and disguised them as doctrines, including the subordination of women to men. Most people fell for it, and I suppose the pagans reacted to this by reversing their original beliefs. Similar to how democrats and republicans frequently switch sides on certain issues because they're reactionary to what people on the other side are doing.

I'm not necessarily sure that men are *scared* per say, as they still have the upper hand in being able to oppress. I think it's out of jealously, knowing they'll never be as sophisticated or capable or happy as the other sex. I feel that way myself and I'm sure most guys do, but most of them hide it like they do all emotions because they're supposed to be "manly", macho, cocky, proud, and angry.

body:
Pagan religion is also the only one that accepts the existence of multiple gods in the first place. The vast majority of them are male and most of the female ones were just a husbands' sidekick outside of a few minority cults. Prostitution and sex slavery were normalized. In the Roman Empire, which had more womens' rights than the vast majority of societies up to that point, it was still illegal for them to even speak in public gatherings. Daughters were arranged marriages by their fathers, meaning the Romans thought the only purpose of woman was to bear children. Yet we have women as literal prophets and rulers in Israel 1000 years prior to that. Indeed, most of the "traditional values" you hear people speak of are solidly Greco-Roman beliefs, not Judeo-Christian ones.

You're right that satan wouldn't be male or female, because he's an angel, not an animal. The same would go with God. But in my experience satan is a lying little dipshit who promises all kinds of liberation and just ends up betraying you in the end. He's like a communist in that regard. He doesn't give a shit about what happens one way or another as long as he controls everyone and everything. He's sadistic. He'll promise you everything you ever wanted, but there's always a huge catch he's not telling you. He's the most massive fraud.

body:
>I've made the case repeatedly throughout this post/thread. The data proves we are unhappier, unhealthier, have less time and are dumber than at any point in recent history.

Liar.  You've provided jack shit to back any of that up.

If we're so unhealthy, why has life expectancy gone up?
https://www.census.gov/content/dam/Census/library/publications/2020/demo/p25-1145.pdf

Levels of education have been going up too.
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Educational_attainment_in_the_United_States

I can't quickly find anything concrete supporting or refuting your claim about free time, but that's your job anyway since you're the one asserting that there's a downward trend.

As for happiness, I don't know how you quantify that as a population metric over the years.  Were things happier when Jim crow laws instituted racial segregation? Were they happier when the Vietnam war and subsequent draft loomed over young people's heads?  Threat of cold war going nuclear keeping everyone feeling warm and snug at night?

Fuck you and your bullshit claims.

body:
Pro tip: if you're telling someone they're losing,  odds are you're outclassed.

I've made specific claims to back my assertions.  You've made half assed copy-pasted irrelevance.... And congratulated yourself for "winning."

No, life expectancy isn't as good an indicator of health as, say,  diabetes, obesity and heart disease.  Fucking retard.  Life expectancy reflects medical advancements in end of life care,  the one's I've listed indicate poor lifestyle choices and bad personal health.  Here: 

Obesity:
https://www.infoplease.com/math-science/health/fitness-nutrition/overweight-and-obesity-in-the-united-states-1960-2000

Childhood type 2 Diabetes:
https://www.cdc.gov/diabetes/research/reports/children-diabetes-rates-rise.html

Cardiovascular Disease:
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3894660/

Now for quality of life....

Suicide:
https://www.statista.com/statistics/187478/death-rate-from-suicide-in-the-us-by-gender-since-1950/

Mental Health:
https://www.mhanational.org/issues/state-mental-health-america

Increased Antidepressant Usage: (even higher in educated women)
https://www.cdc.gov/nchs/products/databriefs/db377.htm

Decreased leisure time:
https://apps.prsa.org/SearchResults/view/7722/105/Americans_today_have_less_free_time_study_says#.YByLE1NOmdM

..... and now to show you that we're dumber. ( Gee, who could've guessed that a generation of participation awards would lead to an increase in meaningless degrees?  Btw, you're definitely not helping):

Reading comprehension decline:
https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/education/2020/10/27/reading-level-math-test-scores-high-school-seniors/3746305001/

IQ decline:
https://www.google.com/amp/s/amp.cnn.com/cnn/2018/06/13/health/falling-iq-scores-study-intl/index.html

Vocabulary decline:
https://online.wsj.com/article/SB10000872396390444165804578010394278688454.html


Need me to change your diaper for you while I'm at it?

Apologize for wasting my time, dolt.

And just so you can start cross referencing the decline,  here's women's participation in the labor force, by year:


https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/LNS11300002

post.body:
More marriages lasted, kids were raised by their mothers instead of the state, homes were cleaner and better administered, women and men were happier, quality of life was considerably better. 

Now the hens abandon the nest as soon as they can just to preen and chase shiny objects that make them feel like they have some type of control. 

If we were any other animal, scientists would be alarmed at our behavior.  We are devolving in real time.

body:
> On average the female IQ is slightly higher

A flagrant lie. The female average IQ is 100 and the male average IQ is 103.

> males are more variable

This is true. Females are more densely concentrated in the "average" area, meaning there are less extremely dumb females and also less extremely smart females.

> I think that's better explained by females being smarter overall, but held to lower expectations, so they work less and are allowed to be lazy

"I think this is the explanation because it supports my sexist belief despite there being no evidence or logical arguments leading to this explanation"
HAHAHHHAHAHHAHAHAHHAHAHAHA no.

> For every 10 male geniuses, there is 1 girl who is more brilliant than half of them combined.

Are you reading the shit you just wrote? You are literally contradicting yourself **twice** with a single sentence.

1) you're implying females are more variable, since you're saying there are 10 male geniuses and 1 female super-genius, when the evidence points to male IQ being more variable

2) you're saying that there's 1 smart female to 10 smart males, therein denying your previous premise, even though it was already false, that women are smarter on average. You literally implied a 10-1 ratio.

parent.body: On average the female IQ is slightly higher, but they account for that by saying males are more variable. However I think that's better explained by females being smarter overall, but held to lower expectations, so they work less and are allowed to be lazy. Of course more males will accomplish a lot when society forces them to succeed. For every 10 male geniuses, there is 1 girl who is more brilliant than half of them combined. I've observed this pattern everywhere I go. Even the world record IQs, are mostly male, but the highest one is female.

body:
> implying we have to ban women from the workforce

No, you fucking moron, I was never implying that. You saw that because that's what you wanted to see, I never said it.

In fact, I've said across several comments that banning women from the workforce, beyond being morally unjustifiable, would be economically shooting yourself in the foot.

I was saying exactly what's fucking written there, you clown: that women wouldn't get out of the workforce given the opportunity. I neither said it's good nor that it's bad in that sentence.

I absolutely hate it when morons who can't read English put words in my mouth.

> the problem of them working

the... problem? One moment you're defending women being in the workforce, the next you're calling it a problem? What the fuck is wrong with you? Why can't you choose a position and stick to it?

parent.body:
Pro tip: if you're telling someone they're losing,  odds are you're outclassed.

I've made specific claims to back my assertions.  You've made half assed copy-pasted irrelevance.... And congratulated yourself for "winning."

No, life expectancy isn't as good an indicator of health as, say,  diabetes, obesity and heart disease.  Fucking retard.  Life expectancy reflects medical advancements in end of life care,  the one's I've listed indicate poor lifestyle choices and bad personal health.  Here: 

Obesity:
https://www.infoplease.com/math-science/health/fitness-nutrition/overweight-and-obesity-in-the-united-states-1960-2000

Childhood type 2 Diabetes:
https://www.cdc.gov/diabetes/research/reports/children-diabetes-rates-rise.html

Cardiovascular Disease:
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3894660/

Now for quality of life....

Suicide:
https://www.statista.com/statistics/187478/death-rate-from-suicide-in-the-us-by-gender-since-1950/

Mental Health:
https://www.mhanational.org/issues/state-mental-health-america

Increased Antidepressant Usage: (even higher in educated women)
https://www.cdc.gov/nchs/products/databriefs/db377.htm

Decreased leisure time:
https://apps.prsa.org/SearchResults/view/7722/105/Americans_today_have_less_free_time_study_says#.YByLE1NOmdM

..... and now to show you that we're dumber. ( Gee, who could've guessed that a generation of participation awards would lead to an increase in meaningless degrees?  Btw, you're definitely not helping):

Reading comprehension decline:
https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/education/2020/10/27/reading-level-math-test-scores-high-school-seniors/3746305001/

IQ decline:
https://www.google.com/amp/s/amp.cnn.com/cnn/2018/06/13/health/falling-iq-scores-study-intl/index.html

Vocabulary decline:
https://online.wsj.com/article/SB10000872396390444165804578010394278688454.html


Need me to change your diaper for you while I'm at it?

Apologize for wasting my time, dolt.

And just so you can start cross referencing the decline,  here's women's participation in the labor force, by year:


https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/LNS11300002

Fucking retard.

body:
I didn't say it was common for women to be smarter than men. Actually I think it is but only overall. There are far more men who are geniuses.

What I said was that this is not due to biological reasons, but because girls are coddled and they're allowed to be lazy and do nothing with their lives; and let's be honest, barely anyone is not going to be lazy unless they're forced to work. Since women maintain average intelligence in spite of this, this alone should be evidence of their superior intelligence capability. Yet we also have the few women who do have legit interests, and most of them are insanely talented and brilliant. There are far fewer female geniuses, but they are significantly smarter than the far more common male ones.

body:
> I absolutely despise AngstKitten and would rejoice at news of her misfortune, therefore it cannot be true that "everyone likes AngstKitten". Maybe everyone in your shithole Discord bubble does, but said shithole is not representative of all Ruqqus.

That doesn't mean everyone else does just because you're a devilish jerk. Like her or not she was a huge contributor. I don't like most reddit powerusers but I can't deny that they contribute a lot. And you're naive if you think *I'm* part of that discord bubble. I'm literally the most vocal voice against it.

> So you're admitting your statement is false. You said are, not were. Great. Having been a top poster over half a year ago doesn't make you a top poster now.

My point was that if she had remained active, she would still be a top poster. Even now in her relative inactivity, she still far outranks most users, even us active ones, purely due to natural ability. And I see that way more often in female users than male ones. Which makes sense, because despite the internet being mostly male-oriented, females have 2 important biological advantages. The first is that they're better at social interactions, so they connect an engage better with users, and have a more distinctive and recognizable persona. The second is that they're more creative and emotional, giving them a huge edge in content creation that most men simply don't have. This is mostly down to how the brain is wired and not personality; if it was, I and the other male users would be like them and not tryhards who just make up shit content or copy things we barely understand.

body:
If you'd been reading my comments I already explained this. Females are simply smarter overall, so a simple shift to the right. However most of them are coddled and not pressured to succeed nearly as much as boys (if a man fails he's a bum, if a girl doesn't do anything she's a perfectly normal wife) and so they become lazy and occupied with girly crap. This is why they don't reach the right side of the curve as often, the potential is there but they don't cultivate it. Because let's be honest, less than 0.01% of people are going to work hard, or even at all, if they don't have to. The tiny handful who do however almost always excel to a large degree, above the majority of the men, including the geniuses.

Even in "male" fields such as STEM and computers, females have been shown to still have a slight edge (though only about 4%, but it'd likely be bigger if they had more confidence). And in the non-STEM fields, men don't stand a chance against the women. This lines up with brain scans that show women have more active brains, optimize for thinking and creativity and intuition (males optimize motor skills instead), and use both hemispheres and have more connections between hemispheres, as opposed to only making use of the left side of the brain (Einstein's brain this too).

parent.body:
If you'd been reading my comments I already explained this. Females are simply smarter overall, so a simple shift to the right. However most of them are coddled and not pressured to succeed nearly as much as boys (if a man fails he's a bum, if a girl doesn't do anything she's a perfectly normal wife) and so they become lazy and occupied with girly crap. This is why they don't reach the right side of the curve as often, the potential is there but they don't cultivate it. Because let's be honest, less than 0.01% of people are going to work hard, or even at all, if they don't have to. The tiny handful who do however almost always excel to a large degree, above the majority of the men, including the geniuses.

Even in "male" fields such as STEM and computers, females have been shown to still have a slight edge (though only about 4%, but it'd likely be bigger if they had more confidence). And in the non-STEM fields, men don't stand a chance against the women. This lines up with brain scans that show women have more active brains, optimize for thinking and creativity and intuition (males optimize motor skills instead), and use both hemispheres and have more connections between hemispheres, as opposed to only making use of the left side of the brain (Einstein's brain this too).

body: Natural masculinity and femininity don't really exist, they're a collection of loosely correlated traits. You can say that punching walls is masculine and crying is feminine, but it's subjective and varies significantly across societies. In eastern countries, it's normal for two men to hug, hold hands, sleep beside each other, etc. but in the USA it's considered gay or unmanly.

Men are more aggressive, women are more empathetic for example, but the makeup of each individual person is way more complex than a strict dichotomy. Let's take me, I'm attacted to men (f), I like baking (f), astronomy (m), technology and science (m), I am sensitive and empathetic (f). Each individual human is unique psychologically, things like gender only provide a backbone or a trend. 

Besides. this is the modern world, gender roles and stereotypes are now next to useless, and don't help move our society forward.

post.body:
More marriages lasted, kids were raised by their mothers instead of the state, homes were cleaner and better administered, women and men were happier, quality of life was considerably better. 

Now the hens abandon the nest as soon as they can just to preen and chase shiny objects that make them feel like they have some type of control. 

If we were any other animal, scientists would be alarmed at our behavior.  We are devolving in real time.

body:
> You're asking for proof yet you won't prove your own arguments

What did I just say about you knowing nothing about debates? lmfao

You don't "prove" arguments, you prove assertions, premises. Arguments can either be valid or invalid, not true or false, ergo you can't "prove" them.

You'd know this if you weren't an edgy 14 year old (which would also explain why you think women are smarter, since, generally speaking, between the ages of 11 and 15, they are)

> The problem is it's impossible to "prove" these matters one way or the other

![](https://i.ruqqus.com/post/7d6m/UeKj7ms8SF8)

1) That's a flagrant lie

2) I wouldn't need to prove a negative

3) Burden of proof falls on you, you're making the assertion contradictory to established scientific data

4) What you can assert without evidence I can dismiss without evidence

> had 

I didn't "have" to, I just got tired of your dumb shit.

> myself to have won the argument

In your dreams, faggot.
